001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
009
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.AbstractDataTypeAdapter;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IDateWithTimeZoneItem;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
016
017import java.time.DateTimeException;
018import java.time.ZonedDateTime;
019import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.regex.Matcher;
022import java.util.regex.Pattern;
023
024import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
025
026/**
027 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
028 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#date-with-timezone">date-with-timezone</a>
029 * data type.
030 */
031public class DateWithTZAdapter
032    extends AbstractDataTypeAdapter<ZonedDateTime, IDateWithTimeZoneItem> {
033  @NonNull
034  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
035      List.of(
036          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "date-with-timezone")));
037  private static final Pattern DATE_TIMEZONE = Pattern.compile("^("
038      + "^(?:(?:2000|2400|2800|(?:19|2[0-9](?:0[48]|[2468][048]|[13579][26])))-02-29)"
039      + "|(?:(?:(?:19|2[0-9])[0-9]{2})-02-(?:0[1-9]|1[0-9]|2[0-8]))"
040      + "|(?:(?:(?:19|2[0-9])[0-9]{2})-(?:0[13578]|10|12)-(?:0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01]))"
041      + "|(?:(?:(?:19|2[0-9])[0-9]{2})-(?:0[469]|11)-(?:0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|30))"
042      + ")"
043      + "(Z|[+-][0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2})$");
044
045  DateWithTZAdapter() {
046    super(ZonedDateTime.class, IDateWithTimeZoneItem.class, IDateWithTimeZoneItem::cast);
047  }
048
049  @Override
050  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
051    return NAMES;
052  }
053
054  @Override
055  public JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType() {
056    return JsonFormatTypes.STRING;
057  }
058
059  @SuppressWarnings("null")
060  @Override
061  public ZonedDateTime parse(String value) {
062    Matcher matcher = DATE_TIMEZONE.matcher(value);
063    if (!matcher.matches()) {
064      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date: " + value);
065    }
066    String parseValue = String.format("%sT00:00:00%s", matcher.group(1), matcher.group(2));
067    try {
068      return ZonedDateTime.from(DateFormats.DATE_TIME_WITH_TZ.parse(parseValue));
069    } catch (DateTimeParseException ex) {
070      throw new IllegalArgumentException(ex.getLocalizedMessage(), ex);
071    }
072  }
073
074  @SuppressWarnings("null")
075  @Override
076  public String asString(Object value) {
077    try {
078      return DateFormats.DATE_WITH_TZ.format(toValue(value));
079    } catch (DateTimeException ex) {
080      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
081          String.format("The provided value '%s' cannot be formatted as a date value. %s",
082              value.toString(),
083              ex.getMessage()),
084          ex);
085    }
086  }
087
088  @SuppressWarnings("null")
089  @Override
090  public ZonedDateTime copy(Object obj) {
091    return ZonedDateTime.from((ZonedDateTime) obj);
092  }
093
094  @Override
095  public IDateWithTimeZoneItem newItem(Object value) {
096    ZonedDateTime item = toValue(value);
097    return IDateWithTimeZoneItem.valueOf(item);
098  }
099}
